intro: Tetracera multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that consist of numerous small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
